intro: Loxostemon granulifer, commonly known as the granular loxostemon, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Its leaves are narrow and covered with a distinctive granular texture, giving it a unique appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats.
